definition: to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Mr Wei rushed to Taipei during his rest day on a Sunday to see Mr Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 魏姓同學便利用星期日趕到臺北和張先生見面。

sentences.english: Boy stole a lesson-book from one of his school-fellows and took it home to his Mother.
sentences.chinese: 有個男孩偷了同學的一本教科書，帶回家給母親。

sentences.english: Kevin Huang and David Lin are classmates.
sentences.chinese: 黃課文和林大衛是同班同學。

sentences.english: Chinese mainland part of the film and television industry friends want to shoot some students in my class.
sentences.chinese: 中國大陸幾個影視界的朋友想讓我班部分同學拍戲。

sentences.english: Xiaowen looks just like all her classmates.
sentences.chinese: 小文看起來就像她所有的同學一樣。

sentences.english: One day Mrs. Slaton gave the class an assignment.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，斯萊頓夫人給全班同學佈置了一項作業。

sentences.english: Lin Bing was enrolled by University of Massachusetts.
sentences.chinese: 林冰同學被麻州大學錄取。

sentences.english: He outshone his fellow pupils in every skill.
sentences.chinese: 他在各種技能上都比他的同學更出色。

sentences.english: Guo eat while watching the picture storybook side starch noodles.
sentences.chinese: 郭同學一邊看小人書一邊喫炒粉。

sentences.english: Bad sexual experiences are the ones students tend to discuss, Freitas said.
sentences.chinese: 糟糕的性體驗是同學們熱於討論的話題之一。

sentences.english: I'm generally pretty impressed by what the, what my classmates  have gotten up to before they came to school here.
sentences.chinese: 我的同學在入學之前已經完成的事情讓我印象深刻。

sentences.english: To his surprise, the new neighbor is his primary school.
sentences.chinese: 令他驚訝的是，這個新鄰居竟然是他的小學同學。

sentences.english: My classmates and I started to climb Mount Tai.
sentences.chinese: 我和同學們開始登泰山。

sentences.english: Good morning, boys and girls. Nice to see you. I am Mrs Zhou .
sentences.chinese: 同學們早上好，我是周老師，見到你們很高興。

sentences.english: I'm going to call on one of my former classmates.
sentences.chinese: 我要去看望我的一位老同學。

sentences.english: He used to inform against his classmates.
sentences.chinese: 他過去常打同學的小報告。

definition: senior male fellow student or apprentice/son (older than oneself) of one's teacher
student/member of an institution of learning/officer cadet
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
senior female fellow student or apprentice/daughter (older than oneself) of one's teacher
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
